definitions.definition: Mental effort to acquire knowledge or learning.
examples: The study of languages is fascinating.

definitions.definition: The act of studying or examining; examination .
examples: I made a careful study of his sister.

definitions.definition: Any particular branch of learning that is studied; any object of attentive consideration.
A room in a house intended for reading and writing; traditionally the private room of the male head of household.
examples: Father spends all his time in the study poring over manuscripts.

definitions.definition: An artwork made in order to practise or demonstrate a subject or technique.
examples: a study of heads or of hands for a figure picture

definitions.definition: The human face, bearing an expression which the observer finds amusingly typical of a particular emotion or state of mind.
examples: Geoffrey's face was a study in amazement [or in bewilderment, irritation, distress etc.]

definitions.definition: A piece for special practice; an etude .

examples: That new study on noncommutative symmetries looks promising.

definitions.definition: One who commits a theatrical part to memory .
An endgame problem composed for artistic merit, where one side is to play for a win or for a draw.
A state of mental perplexity or worried thought.
Thought , as directed to a specific purpose; one's concern .
examples: My study was to avoid disturbing her.

main_definition: Mental effort to acquire knowledge or learning.
secondary_definitions: The act of studying or examining; examination .
Any particular branch of learning that is studied; any object of attentive consideration.
A room in a house intended for reading and writing; traditionally the private room of the male head of household.
An artwork made in order to practise or demonstrate a subject or technique.
The human face, bearing an expression which the observer finds amusingly typical of a particular emotion or state of mind.
( music ) A piece for special practice; an etude .
One who commits a theatrical part to memory .
( chess ) An endgame problem composed for artistic merit, where one side is to play for a win or for a draw.
( obsolete ) A state of mental perplexity or worried thought.
( archaic ) Thought , as directed to a specific purpose; one's concern .
